params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">((p \vee q) \wedge (\text{~}r))</annotation></semantics></math>

params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">((\text{~}p) \to (q \vee r))</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mo stretchy="false">↔<!-- ↔ --></mo>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}p \vee \text{~}q\, \leftrightarrow \,\text{~}(p \wedge q)</annotation></semantics></math>
params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">↔<!-- ↔ --></mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">((\text{~}p) \vee (\text{~}q)) \leftrightarrow (\text{~}(p \wedge q))</annotation></semantics></math>; this is another example of De Morgan’s Laws and it is always true.

questionSetStimulus: For each of the following compound logical statements, add parentheses to indicate the order in which to evaluate the statement. Recall that parentheses are evaluated innermost first.
